page.title: 06THE BASKERVILLE ARMS, CLYRO
page.content: {The Baskerville Arms}in the village of Clyro is a busy country hotel. Many visitiors to the area stay here.It also has a busy non- residential trade. Years ago it was called{"The White {Swan."}This was around 1870 when the Rev. Francis Kilvert was curate of Clyro. Also at this time (1870) The White Swan was the premises for the local court of Clyro{and Painscastle.} In 1890 the name changed to the Baskerville Arms, Baskerville being the name of the family that then owned most of the land and houses in Clyro. In recent years the Hotel has been extended. Some of the beams used in the extension are reputed to have come from{Clifford Castle.}Today the Hotel comprises of a{Restraunt, Lounge and Bar. The bar has facilities for playing {Pool and Darts.
